prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you actively participate in, and what draws you to these specific groups?
I enjoy online golf communiteies
What other hobbies or activities do you enjoy outside of golf, and do you also seek out online content related to these interests?
Bass Fishing
What types of books, movies, or television shows do you enjoy, and do you often look for articles or discussions online related to these interests?
Sports books and magazines
Do you follow any specific sports teams or athletes, and do you enjoy reading online articles or participating in discussions about their performance and strategies?
Kentucky Wildcats
Do you have any interest in travel or outdoor activities, and if so, do you enjoy reading articles or blogs about these topics or specific destinations?
I love to go out into the woods and does some camping as much as possible
Do you have any interest in cooking or trying out new recipes, especially related to camping or fishing, and do you enjoy reading or watching online content about these topics?
Yes I love catching fish and cooking them in a skillet
Do you have any interest in environmental conservation or wildlife, and if so, do you enjoy reading articles or participating in online discussions about these topics?
Yes I think conservation is a great thing for wildlife
Do you have any interest in technology or gadgets, particularly those related to your hobbies like golf, fishing, or camping, and do you enjoy reading reviews or articles about these products?
Yes I have lots of fishing apps downloaded on my ipohone

Do you have any interest in health and fitness, particularly related to your outdoor activities like golf, fishing, or camping, and do you enjoy reading articles or watching online content about these topics?
Yes I like my fitness tracker apps for my walking and running

Do you have any interest in arts or crafts, such as photography or woodworking, particularly related to your outdoor activities, and do you enjoy reading articles or watching online content about these topics?
I love photography and wish I knew more about it

Do you have any interest in history or culture, perhaps related to the places you visit for golf, fishing, or camping, and do you enjoy reading articles or watching documentaries about these topics online?
I like watching history things on tv
Do you have any interest in music or podcasts, perhaps related to your hobbies or interests, and do you enjoy discovering new artists or episodes online?
Yes I often listen to 90s country music
Do you have any interest in gardening or landscaping, perhaps related to your love for the outdoors, and do you enjoy reading articles or watching online content about these topics?
Yes I like keeping my landscaping looking nice and clean

Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no

feedback.feedback_other: Fun study. Thanks for the opportunity.

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
